conclusion: Consider forces acting on the rod and resulting motion to find time t for the rod to slide down.
Gravitational force component along the incline is mg sin θ.
Magnetic force opposing the motion is B^2 L^2 I / R.
At maximum speed, mg sin θ = B^2 L^2 I / R.
Current I in the circuit is I = V / (R + r), where V = B L v.
Velocity v of the rod at maximum speed is v = mg R sin θ / (B^2 L^2 (R + r)).
Acceleration a of the rod is a = g sin θ - B^2 L^2 I / (mR).
Simplified acceleration a is a = g sin θ - mg sin θ / (R + r).
Time t to reach maximum speed is t = v / (g sin θ - mg sin θ / (R + r)).
Final expression for time t is t = mg R sin θ / (B^2 L^2 (R + r) (g sin θ - mg sin θ / (R + r))).
